conclusion: To find the angle between the velocity and the horizontal direction when the slider lands at point C, analyze the motion of the slider from point B to point C.
The slider is ejected horizontally from point B with an initial speed v_B.
The horizontal distance between points B and C is x_BC = 0.9 m.
The height of the experimental platform above the ground is h = 0.53 m.
The vertical motion is under the influence of gravity, described by h = 1/2 g t^2.
Solving for t gives t = sqrt(2h/g) = sqrt(2 * 0.53 / 9.8) ≈ 0.327 s.
The horizontal distance x_BC is covered in time t, so v_B = x_BC / t = 0.9 / 0.327 ≈ 2.75 m/s.
The vertical velocity component just before landing is v_y = g * t = 9.8 * 0.327 ≈ 3.205 m/s.
The angle α between the velocity and the horizontal direction is found using tan α = v_y / v_B = 3.205 / 2.75 ≈ 1.165.
The angle between the velocity and the horizontal direction when the slider lands at point C is approximately 49.4°.
